text: Donkerblond, fijne witte schuimkraag. Licht troebel. Mooie citrus in de neus en in de smaak. Limoentaartje, beetje merengue. Frisse fruitige aanzet die subtiel overvloeit in een citroen-zure afdronk. Zeer goed doordrinkbaar. Medium carbonatie. Top

Lorsque Buxton et Lervig collaborent ça donne naissance à Trolltunga, une bière au style Gooseberry Sour IPA, du trois en un pour un maximum de saveurs. A lorigine, le mot trolltunga signifie la langue du troll et représente une proéminence de falaise située à plusieurs centaines de mètres au dessus dun lac en Norvège, ce qui permet de bien comprendre la subtilité de létiquette. Cette bière est une déclaration damour aux espaces de nature adorés par les brasseurs. Trolltunga, cest une robe jaune et brumeuse avec une légère mousse blanche dégageant des arômes de citron, de houblon et de groseilles. En bouche, on y retrouve des saveurs dherbes, de citron, de pamplemousse, dépices, de pin et de houblon dans un ensemble amer et acidulé. 
Amertume 2/5
Douceur 3/5

330 ml bottle, from Vinmonopolet. ABV is 6.3%. Hazy golden colour, small white head. Aroma of dusty attic, lactic acid and crushed gooseberries. Very sour flavour, loads of lactic acid and sour green gooseberries, unbalanced. Low bitterness. IPA??? Not my cup of tea - wont buy again.

Hoppy / mango aroma. Gold colour without head.
Hybrid taste, between an IPA and a Gueuze. Really special. So acidic taste/aftertaste but not too strong, coming from the gooseberries.
Impressed that they manage to have the ipa side first, then the gueuze side right after 
(sadly gueuze isnt my favorite kind)
Odeur de mangue. Pas de mousse. Un premier gout houblonné. Quasiment aussi acide qu une geuze. Bonne surprise.

On tap at the Buxton Brewery taproom on 26-May-2017. Hazy golden colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma of white fruit and hops. Light to medium body and carbonation. Taste is tart - sour gooseberry all the way. Refreshing and enjoyable.

Keg at the Star and Garter, Bromley. Pale yellow pour with a white head. Lemon juice, lime and grapefruit aroma. Sharp, tart lemon flavour with a splash of green apple and lime. Long sour, bitter linger. Dry as a bone on the palate. Interesting.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Milky yellow, delicate white head. Smell of citrus hops, mint, hints of eucalyptus, gooseberries, zest, light malts. Moderate sweet, a acid wall hits you right in the face, its moderate to medium tart, its lemon and zest, some gooseberries, citrus, alot of herbal influence. Moderate bitter, but most of all tart. Very nice stuff!

Tap @ Handgemacht - hazy pale yellow color, white head. sourness comes straight to your face. some salt as well. berries. green fruits. dry finish. body is quite light. comes very fresh. for lovers of sours this is a great one.

Bottle. Pours a clear straw colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of gooseberries, fruity vinegar, pear, hay, forest floor and some barnyard. Sour flavour of berries, lime, dry hay and vinegar. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a light bitterness. A sour but well-balanced ale that is easy drinking.

Aroma is nice and subtle: sour berries, freshly cut grass, grassy hops, tarty. Taste is in your face, pure sourness (first sip). It then calms down, leaving a nice flavor of gooseberries, lime and tart. Long, sourish-bitter aftertaste. Refreshing and interesting.

0,33 l bottle. Pours straw yellow with a good finger of white lasting head. Plenty of gooseberry, citrus and sourness dominate nose, some herbal and resin notes are present. Plenty of gooseberry in flavor too, along with some malt and pineapple. Body is light sweet, light bitter and medium sourness, light salty too. Body is medium, texture slick, carbonation is average to lively. Finish is quite long, light bitter and sour.
Light golden. No head. A tiny bit of visible carbonation. Aroma is lime and herbs. Taste is gooseberry, red berries, and lime..

On keg at the Hanging Bat. 
Appearance - cloudy golden with a decent lacy head. 
Nose - green stalk and lime. Gooseberry I guess. 
Taste - big gooseberry and lime which is brought alice by the long sour tang.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a tangy middle section. The finish is a continuation of this.
Overall - really good.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A golden beer, light opaque, with a big white head ; medium retention. Red berries (blackberry, gooseberry, citrus), herb, light resin. Light sweet, light to medium dry lasting acid refreshing, light dry bitter. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation, dry fruity acid lasting finish. Overall, delicious ! Nice fruity character ; thirst-quencher.

20. 4. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Shared with Viki. Very direct and pronounced sour taste and mouthfeel with not so lasting aftertaste. Still not my cup of beer though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Very nice taste, loads of gooseberry, light sourness. Aroma has full on citrus and bitterness. So easy drinking. Great stuff.

Off white fluffy head soon left a cover on hazy orange still body. Bitter orange aroma. Medium bodied, crisp, clean & sharp on the palate. Taste is sour fruits, bitter orange, pineapple. A really palate cleanser!

From a 33 cl bottle it is a cloudy effervescent golden color with a sligh head. The Aroma is of tart berries and the taste is Sour gooseberries which dominates. Interesting and refreshing in a weird way

From a 33 cl bottle purchased at Trio in Kitty Hawk, NC. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Aroma of tart berries and a bit of vinyl. Sour gooseberries dominate the flavor. A delightful puckerfest.

imbottigliata 7 mesi fa e forse incide.
Appena aperta arriva al naso una vampata di Fanta che perô sfuma subito lasciando spazio a frutta non meglio precisata (lavessi mai assaporata direi uva spina ma io dico qualcosa tipo pesca).
Sulla lingua del troll vince lacido, secondo il dolce, terzo lamaro. Il tutto accompagnato da una sana frizzantezza che ti fa scomparire la birra in bocca.

Unclear, yellow colored, medium white head, decent lasting. Aroma is of malt, fruity, lemony citric, some barnyard notes, medium sourness. Taste is medium sweet malt, fruity berry, lemony citric and lemon juice, some barnyard, moderate acidity, dry. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2017 Pours hazy straw with a small bubbly head, quite fizzy. Fantastic to the nose with strong gooseberry. Very tart attack, with yogurt, gooseberry, and strong hoppiness in the mix with notes of lemon and mango. Light bodied, smooth and well carbonated, very pleasantly sour. Pretty good ale, different.

Bottle, courtesy of derA. Pours clear yellow. Aroma is gooseberry, dirty fruit, lacto, funk, some stables. Body is medium, lightly sour and rather tart, fizzy carbonation. Very good balance. Medium berry finish. Great drinking experience.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Bottle. Yellow-golden color with white head. Aroma is gooseberry, stone fruits, lacto, petroleum hops. Taste is gooseberry, tropical fruits, lacto. Sour finish, silky mouthfeel. Excellent!

Pours a slightly hazy, light golden liquid with a thin, white head.
Nose: Wonderful, tart, fruity, hoppy, almost soapy aromas of lemon, lime, gooseberries (yes) green apples, honey. In the background some lactic notes.
Taste: It tastes like it smells; its partly like chewing lemon but with such a wonderful fruitiness that you still want more. Theres some saltiness hovering somewhere in the background, playing 3rd or 4th violin, next to the mild hops bitterness. Also here I find some (nice) lactic notes, somehow just reigning in the acidity. The body is medium light, so is the carbonation. The aftertaste is acidic, bitter, very fruity and long.
This is so well balanced its just delicious! A beer for sour beer and acid riesling lovers. Best served on warm days, to thirsty people or with food!
On tap. Pours a gold/Amber with light head. Aromas of lemons, nectarines and green berries. Flavors of green blackberries, gooseberries, nectarines and light wheaty malts. Intense. Wonderful.

Floral with an extremely pleasant tart sensation, gooseberry, golden with a good white head quite persitant, light body, fizzy, again gooseberry, sour, floral notes, very easy to drink...i want crates of this beer.
Keg @ Pilcrow, Manchester. Blonde with a thick head. Its sourness dominates, but behind this a fruitiness is evident.

its not often, that I come to RB to rate a beer which already has ample ratings agreeing with my findings but this needs to have an exception. Buxton and Lervig have really outdone themselves. The nose is stone fruit, yellow berries and some leather-straw-barnyard funk, needs some time to warm up though, so dont drink it too cold. The real experience is the aroma coupled with its excellent mouthfeel. The beer feels refreshing as it strikes an excellent balance between upfront sourness and long lasting aroma of berries and citrus juice. The finish leaves you with an uplifting tartness put into place with just a hint of hop bitterness. At no point does this beer feel one dimensional or simple but sips keep being entertaining and refreshing at the same time!

33cl bottle from Otters Tears, Burslem. A slightly hazy amber pour with a thick white head that quickly falls away; gooseberry aroma, not unlike a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc; spritzy in the mouth with a refreshingly tart gooseberry taste; and a rather acidic finish with a hint of pear skins. Rather good.
33cl bottle at cervetoria. Hazy gold color. Medium sourness, light sweetness. Thin medium body. Aroma and flavour citric, berries, leaves.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 Geur: rot ei, durian, putteke, t ruimerke; paradoxaal fijne geur. Melkzuur, mango en citrus + ipa. Bessen in de afdronk. Weggeblazen door deze ongelofelijke sour.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. TCBW. Fantastyczne, kwaśno-gorzkie (BARDZO kwaśne), cholernie agrestowe cudo. Chciałbym mieć na kranie, piłbym w nieprzyzwoitych ilościach.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden yellow colour with a thick frothy head. Tart and fruity but not too sweet. Very drinkable.

Amarelo claro de leve turbidez, espuma branca de média formação e pouca persistência. Leve lúpulo frutado e acidez cítrica. Paladar de leve amargor, acidez e salgado. Corpo leve e baixa carbonatação. Final breve mantendo parte do amargor e acidez cítrico, sem definição, sensação aguada, terrível...
Provavelmente foi armazenada errado e sofreu com isso.

Very sour with deep over ripe mango skins and gooseberry. Fantastic mix of hops and sourness. Fairly sour. Lots of fruit sourness from gooseberry which is interesting. Very interesting. The hops play well with the sourness. Not overly bitter finish. Very unique. Good stuff
Tan-bodied, light head. Sour grapefruitty and catty nose. Tart, but restrained minerally body. Nice gooseberry notes. Sour, sweet tart finish. Bright and well-balanced.
Bottle from Hopduvel. Clear golden colour, white foam, disappears quickly. Nose of tropical fruit, bitter hops, tart berries. Sour taste with bitter hoppy finish. Very well balanced. Nice fruit IPA!

At Beerlovers bar. Pours rather clear blonde. Small white head. Smell is highly aromatic fruity, a sour/bitter combo underneath. Taste is sour, full, malty, fruits. Bitterness is overpowered by the previous factors. Very intense. Not bad at all ! Rather dry mouthfeel .

Bärartad, grön, ren doft med elegant humlekaraktär. Mjuk tallbarrsöt exotisk frukt, ananas, passionsfrukt, citrus.
Ljust gyllene brygd. Snabbt försvinnande skum och kvar blir endast en tunn hinna. Smaken har en utpräglad karaktär av krusbär, citron, lime, en aning mjölksyra och en aning gräsartad källararom. Subtilt elegant och komplex utan att beskan tar över. Torr avslutning med humle, tall, citron och gräs i eftersmaken. Halvtorr avrundning. Kroppen är balanserad liksom kolsyran.

Lukt: Syrlige frukter og høy.
Utseende: Lys gulbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Syrlig greapefrukt og høy.

Kommentar: Et friskt og godt øl.
Heller, säuerlich zitroniger Antrunk. Spritzig, intensiv, die Säure bleibt auf hohem Niveau. Vollmundig, sehr süffig. Gut. 10/10/11/11//11
Not my cup of tea. Im much into lambic, but this kind sour seems unbalanced. And the mouth feel is a bit too watery. And it upsets my stomach... But some interesting aromas though.
@Hatten 16-12-12: ganska lätt med en trevlig syrlig ton och lite lätt frukt, inget spektakulärt men helt ok

Appearance is golden and a little hazy, a small white head which quickly disappears. Aroma- gooseberry, orange peel, pine, slight lambic, tropical fruit. Taste- lots of tart fruit, sour sweets, sticky fruit, orange and pineapple, malty cereal undertones, good amount of carbonation to help things along, mouthfeel is full and a bit sticky, leading to a lasting finish. Good stuff.
strågul, lett tåkete uten skum. Herlig duft med sure bær, stall og høy, Det samme følger i smaken sammen med en bittersur, tørr avslutning. Veldig god og frisk.

Pours a cloudy golden color with medium white head. Aroma is very citrusy, lemon, orange zest, gooseberries, pineapple, grapefruit and slightly mango. Taste is tart and hoppy, follows the nose, strong citrus notes, with lemon zest, orange, grapefruit, grass and berries. Very fresh and refrshing.
Right degree of sour combined with fruity aroma and taste. Cloudy golden color. $5.79 for 11.2 ounce bottle was a bit pricey.

Colour between yellow and orange, slightly hazy, with some thin streaks of white head. Plenty of fruit on the nose: pineapple, grapefruit, lemon, mango, and yes, gooseberry. Slightly sour, bit more tart in the mouth, very refreshing and fruity.

Great sour. Perfectly balanced.

Yet another awesome collaboration involving Lervig.

Keg at heiorun. A hazed golden yellow straw with a girl even off white head. Aroma is zesty grapefruit, tropical peach, salty, zesty, nice fruits. Flavour is composed of crisp sour, pithy lemon, funky tropical fruits, mango, sour. Pinch of salt, sour. Tangy pineapple, . Palate is tangy, sour, highish, spritzy carbonation. Really good.
Clear gold amber pour and pleasant sour fruits aroma. Tons of gooseberries on the taste aswell as lemon, yoghurt & slight hoppy bitterness. Good balance of sour & hops, highly quaffable!

33cl bottle shared. Pale golden, clear, with a thin white head and visible carbonation. Tons of gooseberries in the nose, followed by apples and a bit of brett. Taste notes include gooseberries, lemon juice, floral hops and a bit of brett bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation and a tart and refreshing finish.
Hazy orange color, white frothy head. Pineapple nose, peach, lemon, floral. Citrus taste, lemon, sour berries, yogurt, minerals, tart finish. Medium body, average carbonation.

Pours a hazy yellow color, topped with a rather small white head, not lasting. Nice citrusy nose, sour lemony feel to it. Some sweet tones. Not too intense, but easy to pick up. Taste is moderately sour, lemony and citric with some final fruity feel Dry finish with sparkly body. Slight bittery touch in the end. A bit puckering but not too much. Very nice. Light body and easily drinkable.

Aroma; orange, hops, juicy malts, tropical fruits in the spruce. 
Look; pearl head, misty pale golden body, crocheted lacing. 
Taste; sour fruits, lemon lemon, sweet pale malts far back, sour citric tropic intermezzo and fading sour fruits in epilog.
Feel; juicy.
Overall; as some energyboost.
[33cl.btl 6.3% @Sånn Tromsø]
Pale gold, slightly cloudy with a thin white head. Big fruity aroma, passionfruit, citrus and a little funkiness. Taste is tart, tropical fruit, berry, little bitterness. Nice one.
Half at port st beer house manchester. Citrus, grapefruit, lemon, apple, strawberry nose. Flavour is a tart apple, grapefruit, lemon finish. Super dry finish. Lovely

On tap in Louisville (KY)

Despite a crowded and well curated draft list at Holy Grale ordering a half pour of Trolltunga was a no brainer. With Buxtons reputation for sours and a price point not much above a 12 ounce bottle I jumped at the chance. You should do the same as well.

Aroma / Appearance - A rose gold body shimmers with a sassy tropical spirit not native to either the UK or Norway. Wheat, pineapples, and light tartness brighten the mood. Focused and sharp, it cuts through the air like a knife.

Flavor / Palate - Pineapple, mango, and semisweet dessert wine tickles the tongue. Rather than the abrasive raw nature of a pure sour this delicately toes the line of dry and tart. The acidity does not truly emerge until a few seconds after a sip. If you are looking for a new experience then get a bottle or find it on tap.

Bottle. Clear gold with a small white head. Aroma of damp hay, toasted grain, underripe fruit and sweat. Gooseberry is not obvious. More so upon a sip though - fruity with that distinctive acid bite. Theres some sourness to go with the acidity (some berries and some lacto Id guess given the texture), and some grainy sweetness and finishing bitterness as well. A bit salty at the end too. Opened up a little after a while. There seems to be quite a lot going on and theres nothing _wrong_ with it but it somehow manages to be a bit dull.

Huge white head. Clear yellow body with one thick stream of fast bubbles. Strong funky gooseberry jam aroma with herbal notes. Sweet-acidic mineraly gooseberry taste. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish fruity gooseberry aftertaste leading into powerfully salty finish rather like sea water. Really odd, and the finish is really too much. (0.33l bottle, from wine monopoly Storo.)

330ml bottle at home in Richmond, as Buxton Trolltunga, collab with Lervig, 6.3%, BB Aug 2017. Vibrant golden orange, hazy, lightly sparkling, foamy cratered white head leaves nice lacing. Aroma is fresh and citrussy, lemon, green apple, watermelon. Body is fairly light, very fizzy, a touch foamy. Taste is pretty tart, lots of lemon, gooseberry, sherbet. Bracing tartness and some acidity. Not a beginners sour, but fruity and balanced. Tasty. Really like the intensity of the flavour. The heavy carbonation detracts but it does die down over time.
From tap at CBC 2016. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, sourness, grass, citrus and gooseberries.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a small frothy head. Aroma is hoppy with tropical fruits. Taste is excellent. The sourness hits you straight away. Lemon, berries and a lovely saltiness. Brilliant!

Light gold color, slightly higher than average carbonation. Aromas of tropical fruits, apples, cinnamon, caramel, nice hoppy aroma. At first sip, I found the acidity to be quite intense and puckering, but it may have been the quality of the acidity. It really grew on me and, at the end of the day, is not that sour. Tart berry notes, some malty sweetness in the end, clearly dry hopped, very little hop flavor, but a touch. Complex and nice. Not amazing, but good.
How: bottle Appearance: hazy golden, medium white head. Aroma: grapefruit, unripe berries, lingonberries, grass and minerals. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation.
Very fruity and sweet aroma. Minimal top. Taste is sour and reminds of a bead dough. Would not drink a lot of this sticky brew.

Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a small white head. The aroma is lots of grapefruit and gooseberry. Light acidic notes. The flavor is tart and zesty with gooseberry and grapefruit notes. Easy drinkable and very tasty.

Bottle from Mother Kellys, Bethnal Green.
Probably one of the better sour beers tried this year. 
A nice golden colour with weak white head.
The nose is citrussy and hoppy with wild yeast.
On palate is heavy lemon and grapefruit flavor, some finishing florals.
The sour taste is not too heavy, just a nice tang.

iana niska, sycząca, nietrwała, szybko redukuje się do postrzępionej firanki. Barwa słomkowa, lekko opalizująca. W aromacie wyraźne białe owoce - agrest, biała porzeczka, niedojrzały winogron, do tego delikatne cytrusy i niewielka kiszonka. Fajnie. Smak zdecydowanie kwaśny, orzeźwiający, porzeczkowo agrestowo cytrynowy w tle jakieś zioła, kwiaty... Goryczka niska. Wysycenie średnie, lekkie w odbiorze.
Dość proste, kwaśne piwo na upały. W sumie mało się tu dzieje, ale to wcale nie przeszkadza, aby było pijalnie i smacznie.
Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma of funk, bitter citrusy hops, earth and berries. Taste is sour, gooseberries, earth and bitter grapefruit.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Goudgeel met een witte kraag troebel. Geur en smaak met sinaasappel en citroen, daarna komt het melkzuur en karnemelk. Nice.

One of the better sour beers. Not super sour, just a nice tang. Nice golden colour and decent head in a tulip glass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, gooseberries, malt and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and sour with some gooseberries, herbs and berries. Medium body, average carbonation.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 3/14/2016. Pours hazy/cloudy golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big sour lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange, gooseberry, guava, papaya, pineapple, citrus peel, light pepper/pine, cracker, bread, light lacto funk, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, gooseberry, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange, gooseberry, guava, papaya, pineapple, citrus peel, light pepper/pine, cracker, bread, light lacto funk, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate fruity/acidic sourness and light bitter/spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange, gooseberry, guava, papaya, pineapple, citrus peel, cracker, bread, light funk, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, gooseberry, and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/sourness balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light increasing dryness from acidity as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately acidic, and grainy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6.3%. Overall this is an excellent sour IPA! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, gooseberry, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the balanced acidity. A very enjoyable offering.

No head. Strong nose of sweetness of yellow berries and nice hops. Hazy clear orange body. Very sour in mouth with long and sweet palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Brewdog shop.
Small white head, not much lacing. Hazy golden body. Strong gooseberry nose, very sweet, just a wee hint of mustiness. Flavour is very sour, gooseberry all the way, a little sherbet, tart gooseberry finish. Light carbonation, good mouthfeel, not too dry on the finish, a little hint of oiliness as it goes down. Tremendous sour.
Bottle from Whole Foods. Hazy gold pour with white head. Nose is tart citrus, hops, mild yeast. Tastes tart, citric, with heavy lemon and grapefruit flavor, some finishing florals
@ Kristoffers väg 23/7-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and acidic with citrus. Body is medium, the finish is dry, acidic and fruity with citrus.

Pours clear light golden with good lasting white head. Aromas of light malt, light funk and slight grass hops with a hint of melon. Decent carbonation and medium mouth feel. Taste is gooseberry with a good sour hit which fades to a nice light biscuit malt not dissimilar to a good pilsner. Very pleasant and refreshing summer beer.

Bottle. Golden body with lasting white head. Aroma is sour and fruity with herbs in the background. Taste is nice sour with lacto in the background and some fruits. Aftertaste is sour. Nice but I am missing the ipa.

Pours a cloudy golden with a big fluffy head. A strong hoppy aroma with a hint of saltiness too. A really sharp, sour kick in the gob is met with a sweet bitterness at the end. Kind of like sucking on a lemon. A like this a lot.
Pours light golden in the glass with a frothy white head. Nose of citrus and wheat. Taste is soooper sour with gooseberry kick. A great sour beer.

On tap at TCBW 2016. Hazy pale yellow with a decent white head. Wow! Nice sour fruit and berries, some yeasty and slightly funky notes, citrus and hints of malt. Sour, fruity and quite delicious. Surprisingly refreshing and easy to drink.

Draught @ TCBW 2016. Pours cloudy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of sourish gooseberries, fruits, grass, hints of berries. Taste is smooth, slightly tart and fruity with some gooseberries, mild sourness and lactic notes, hints of hops. Finish is crisp, sourish and slightly tart with some fruits and funky notes. Interesting.

On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of passionfruit, citrus and some hints of perfume. Similar taste. Also some mango and hints of malt. The finish was dry and sour.

Vom Fass in Singapur. Trübes gelbes Bier, heller instabieler Schaum. Saurer Duft. Beeren, Apfel ist und Zitrone. Der Antrunk ist richtig sauer, fastEssigsäure! Klasse! Danach frisch, Zitrone und Limette.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is citrusy hops with tropical notes of peaches, as well as some sour notes of gooseberries and fruit peel. Medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour is lactic, with sweet floral notes, wood, gooseberries and grapes, as well as some mineraly notes. Lingering tartness in the finish.

0.33l bottle from B213. Oh, this smells superb! So fruity and citrus fresh! In the glass this is a cloudy yellow golden colored one with a small not too impressive looking islandy grey head, but the aroma is really something. Tons of stone fruits and a really generic freshness. Some lemons in the blend also. And hops. Lots of them. Tastes really good also. Its more sour than I though, and i like it. Feels nice and oily in the mouth and its below average on the relatively soft carbonation. Soda powder and sorrel with traces of wood, white currants and all he way in the back some green sour gooseberries. Lovely stuff for sure, and I would definitely not mind having this again! 19.03.2016

Bottle at home, 19/03/16.
Hazed golden orange with a well appointed egg shell white head.
Nose is tangy green berry funk, gooseberries, light floral, balsa wood, yuzu tunes.
Taste comprises juicy yuzu snap, damp hay, lemoni rind, green apple sherbets, funky, light acidic vibes, on the turn melon, green berry compote.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a moderate puckering effect.
Super solid well balanced and refreshing sour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Golden, cloudy. Aroma is gooseberry, lemon and yeast. Taste is very sour with gooseberries and lemon. Dry. Very nice!!

13.03.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sour-ish dry, weeds, sour grass, minerals, berry skin, unripe berries, citrus acid, hops, leafs, rubber. Taste is dry sour-ish, citrus acid, sour grass, unripe berries, minerals, berry skin, sorrel, hops, leafs, moss. Medium bitterness, acidic dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle. Fuzzy golden yellow pour. Nice aroma of tart berries, citrus and grain. Sour taste of strong sour berries, harsh tart, oak, acidic citrus, mango, tropical fruit and mild salt in the finish. Nice.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours hazy glowing golden with a one inch creamy white head.Lovely strong and powerful aroma of passion fruit, ripe fruits. Moderate sweet fruity taste, pleasant acidic passion fruit, carbonated like a fruit soda, lively and weak tarty finish, very good.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm  Cloudy golden, creamy head. Perfumy nose with some lemon. Pungent citric acidity, medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Citric acid, perhaps hints of gooseberry and mango. Puckering sourness remains in the finish. One big flavour - well expressed. No edges. Technically very correct, just not very interesting. Like sour candy.

Bottle at home in London - sourced from Eebria. Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head that settles into a relaxed cream. Wonderful aroma, with lots of passion fruit, melon, orange, and a bit of pine. Light sweet flavour with assertive tartness, some lemon juice, more passion fruit, tangerine, citrus zest, soft piney bitterness, wheat. Light bodied with average, spritzy carbonation. Highly quenching and refreshing on the finish, fairly dry, with moderate acidity, some citrus rind, a little grass, lemon, tangerine, grapefruit pith. Exceedingly drinkable. Outstanding beer.

5th March 2016Hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Nose of gooseberry and hop skunk. Palate is light, fairly dry and has decent fine carbonation. Tart gooseberry blends well with hop spice and pine. Touch of lemon and a trace of sherbet. Light dry finish. Nice sour/wild IPA hybrid.
Tapp. Lys gul uklar farge. Lite karbonert. Lite skum. Smaker sitrus,hvete,sure bær, tropisk frukt. Frisk

Bottle from Bradleys. Cloudy, vibrant gold with a tiny head. Aroma full of sour gooseberry. Possibly the best tasting beer Ive ever had. I could believe this wasnt alcoholic it is so fruity and sour.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light orange with a fading white bubbly head. Aroma is of apples, pears, citrus, oranges, honey. Taste is of white grapes, pineapple, apples, pears, citrus, zesty, tart finish. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Cirkus 200216. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sourness, fruit, orange, gooseberries. Flavour is sourness, gooseberries, lemon, fruit, pine, orange, citrus. Easy drinkable very nice beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy gold. Aroma of sour berries, passion fruit and lime. Taste is sour with some fruity sweetness. Really nice and refreshing, very good sour beer.

On tap at Cirkus. An unclear pale orange colored beer with a small white head. The aroma has lots of sourish citrus, some notes of pine cones and a good dash of orange. Its medium bodied and dry on the palate, perhaps a tad heavy on the carbonation. Sour citrus and oranges in the lightly funky and pleasantly bitter flavor. Dry and lasting sour and orange finish. A delicious thirst quencher. 160220
Bottle. Pour is murky gold with a thin head, aroma is fruity, sweet. Taste is powerful, pleasant sourness, loads of grapefruit. Very enjoyable

Probably my favorite Buxton beer to date. Nice sourness and fruity notes of gooseberry ends up with an amazing hoppy bitterness of fresh tropical fruit. It mixes two beer styles in to a perfect fizzy brew. Well done!
Bottle at Aidys... Hazy amber.. Light haze... Soft tart Gooseberry fruits... Soap zezty lime and Gooseberry.. Juicy tart zezty sharp tart fruits.. Light fizz

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of pineapple, passionfruit, lime zest and bitter lemon. Flavour of fresh lemon with a tangy, dry finish. Medium body with a champagne-like texture. Very fizzy. A unique, tasty beer. It reminds me of BrewDogs original Elvis Juice.

Bottle as a Christmas gift from Jill. Cheers! Pours a fairly cloudy blond with a frothy white head. Nice big hoppy aroma with notes of grapefruit and gooseberry. The taste is rally sour with loads of tarts fruits - grapefruit, lemon and gooseberry that lingers in the slightly dry finish. Pretty amazing.
Cest très chouette / Attaque mordante / Joyeux fruité acide et crémeux. Fin gaz démonstratif. Fin de bouche douce et sucrée ... Comme un bonbon acide sans le côté industriel du goût.
Drank at PP playing Catan for the first time. Hazy light orange-gold, fizzy white head. Sourness is moderate-to-heavy, very citric/orange and yeasty.

Bottle from SIPS at PP. Hazy straw yellow pour with minimal thin head. Aroma is sour gooseberry hops - makes sense. Taste is similar - moderate sourness with bitter fruity hops bite. Clean tasting with lingering tart dry finish - almost like a very crisp white wine. Light body. Not bad at all. Quite nice for a clean somewhat sour IPA. Not too hoppy and balances the sourness with a pleasant berry fruitiness.

Pours hazy golden with a finger of frothy white head. Aroma of mango and passion fruit, some lime, maybe hints of citrus. Taste is a surprise, fairly rich citrus tart, that mellows out and turns into a fruit sweet finish. Cant really pick up the gooseberries, but nice nonetheless. Body is light and crisp with average carbonation.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines, Birmingham. Poured a light straw colour with a bubbly round head. The aroma is big gooseberry, yeast, mineral. The flavour is moderate sour with a soft smooth acid citrus light doughy biscuit palate. Light bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Very hazy straw with a small off white head. Aroma of gooseberries, lemon, really tart fruit. Flavour is over moderate sour. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Fra fat på ØST etter krankupp med Pohjala jan-16, sammen med Ovesen: en høyst påkrevd munnrens etter den intenst sødmepregede Pohjala Pime Öö. Uklar korngul med flott skum som varer. Oppkvikkende graperukt/citronaroma med litt løvetann. Superfrisk med stikkelsbær i tillegg til grapefrukt og citron. Akkurat passe syrlig, hadde fint greid et par glass av denne.

From bottle at Øst with JMD 28.01.16. Cloudy, pale golden. White head and lacing. Aroma of wild, sour gooseberries and white pepper. Dry and acid, with gooseberries and lemon. Very refreshing and quaffable.

33cl bottle from Eebria. It pours a lightly hazel golden color with a large white head. Aroma is tart acidic and tangy with notes of lemon juice citric acid Greek yoghurt sea salt and gooseberries. Taste was sour and lightly sweet with more sharp lemony notes, gooseberries, apricots, light stra and funk and more lactic acid. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, a superlative brew

330ml bottle at home. Pours murky yellow gold with a thin white head. Strong gooseberry aromas, but slightly sweet, like gooseberry jam. Taste is tart and sharp though, nice sourness. Almost lactic mouthfeel. My only criticism is that its more like a soft drink than a beer, but its very refreshing.
Leicht trübes hell goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig hopfig, spritzig säuerlich. Geschmack säuerlich, spritzig, grasig, angenehm hopfig bitter, leicht zu trinken.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Pours hazy pale gold with a quickly diminishing loose white Head . The Aroma is of fresh pink grapefruit, the taste is lemon sherbety, ,gooseberry sharp & lipsmacking & sour , wow what a hit ! With hoppy fruit ,grapefruit & passion fruit plus light biscuit Nice !l light bodied with above average carbinination , the finish is long with more grapefruit &. Passion fruit coming thru ,lemon sherbty,goosebury ,tangy ,sour ,bitter & dry . This is a classy brew from Buxton if you can handle it !
På kran på Øst. Gul, melkematt kropp med lys film. Røkelse, sitrongress og druer blant aromaene. Meget innbydende. Deilig frisk smak av grapefrukt og melkesyre. Noe fylde. Nydelig.

330ml bottle from Eebria.com. Hazy yellow colour, bubbly white foam head that dissipates away and aroma of tropical fruits, hoppy with grain & biscuit. Taste is sour, gooseberries, citrus zest, fruity, hop resins and some tangy bitterness. Tart, crisp mouthfeel, light bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry bitter & sour finish. Nicely drinkable.

Hazy bright yellow color with a small white head that reduce to a film with a bit of lacing. Aroma is really fresh and fruity with intense citrus and hop notes. Taste starts tart and fruity with some citrusy, grassy hops in the background. Just a slight bitterness on the finish. Dry aftertaste. Body and carbonation are medium. Really nice one, fresh, tart and hoppy.
Big juicy sour IPA, gooseberry juice added to beer from info on label. citrus, hazy, heavily sour, lively.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy yellow with a small white soapy head. Light to medium body with fizzy carbonation. Very sour with subtle bitter tones. Green apples, vinegar, citrus and grass. Overwhelming sourness, but still very good.
Bottle at home. Pours cloudy pale yellowish. Nose is juicy sour, fruits. Taste is juicy, sour, berries, gooseberry, fruits. Good.
Bottle at home from eebriaopaque pale blonde, frothy white head, tart gooseberry and citrus nose, immediate source hit, citrus juice, wheaty middle section, sharp, lightly bitter, cleansing.
330ml bottle. Pours very hazy lemon gold with a medium frothy head. Aroma is light sharp gooseberry and mango. Taste is very sour. Touches of cheese. Tart gooseberry on the finish.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with white head. Smell is incredible, hoppy and sharp, grapefruit and passion fruit. Taste is initially similar, grapefruit and passion fruit but then theres a bit of an earthy yeast thing going on which once gone leaves a flavour of haribo sweets. Very sour and refreshing
A welcome drink after 7 hours climbing a hill in horrendous conditions. Pours hazy yellow, nose is sharp gooseberry, funky, taste is incredibly sour, dry, fruity.

Bottle from Beer Central, thanks to my lovely wife. It pours cloudy bright gold with a thick white head. The nose is fresh, juicy, big grapefruit vibe, gooseberry, candied lemon peel, funky, and light sherbet. The taste is crisp, tart, sour gooseberry, grapefruit, sherbet, decent mouth - pucker, fresh tropical fruits, sour candy and light acidity with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Juicy, tart and refreshing. Delicious!

330ml bottle from Saveur Biere. Bottled 19NOV15.


Ugly yellow colour with a white head. Refreshing berrish aroma, berry sour flavour too and fresh. Good one.
Best sour ale Ive had. Massive fruity aromas, with a big sour gooseberry flavour, very refreshing and crisp. Full and flavoursome. Really good.

Keg at Port Street Beer House, Manchester. A cloudy golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of gooseberry, a little lemon, subtle pineapple and some biscuit. Taste of gooseberry, a little lemon, subtle salt, slight biscuit and maybe yogurty funk. Medium bodied and a slick texture. A refreshingly tart, citrus finish. A very nice sour, very fruity, a good amount of tartness and very drinkable.

Bottle. Nose is goseberry, lime, hint of tropical, and yeast. Im vary wary of Buxtons recent use of yeast which has smelled horrific, and this is not unpleasant but is still not quite right. 

Taste is strong goseberry, lime, pineapple, tart lemon, faint pine note, and a hint of Lilt (or at least my 20 year old memory of Lilt) 

Its a reasonable beer, but its one of many sour beers, and in a saturated market its hard to get excited about it; there are tens of decent fruity sour beers.

330ml bottle, thanks to Chris G who I believe purchased direct from Buxton HQ. Pours murky yellow, thin foam head. Aroma is vibrant fruity gooseberry. Taste is massively tangy, sharp, fruity, lots of zest and some funk. Hugely delicious thirst-quenching, flavoursome sour. Like.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Very cloudy, orange barley squash colour. Frothy head collapses to a dense, skim of white. Looks great. Very enticing. Nose has gooseberry crumble. A ton of peach and grapefruit hop, too. Background yeasty, bready malts. Light notes of sticking plaster. Taste is tart, soft sweet, with a rising bitterness. Crisp, mouth-wateringly tart palate. Tart, light bitter finish. I could drink lots of this.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. A fascinatingly delicious beer. Super juicy fruit. Genuine jammy tartness. Lurking in the background, is a tangy hopped pale ale. Very tasty and engaging. Works a treat.

Bottle at home, ordered from Eebria, 5th December 15. Aroma is bitter hops and fruit. Taste is sour funky gooseberries and citrus, quite biting. Hops come through, just about, but lots of gooseberry. Its good but in my opinion should be brewed and drunk in the summer, in the sun in the garden....

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy light orange pour with a creamy off white head, aroma has tart fruits along with some light funk and citrus, taste has zesty lemon, tart gooseberry, a hint of funk, some hop bite, nice.
Bottle at Bottlecraft, Hanley. Pours hazy pale gold with a white froth. Well balanced sour, nicely hopped, cracking sour.
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Aroma of berries and hops. Sour is predominant compare to IPA taste. Light on the palate, full body. Very good!!

Sour fruit, and a light funk yeast on the aroma, it tastes sour and salty , with lots of fresh fruit flavours. A champagne like tingle on the tongue, its a pity it looks so bad, cant remember giving a 1 for appearance before, a cloudy pale yellow.

Bottle from via Eebria, consumed at home Thursday 26th November 2015   Hazy murky dusty faded light beige sort of colour with a fast disappearing head.Goosegogs on the nose with a little wheatiness but also a little hop. Mmhhh... this is a sour IPA, in that there is clearly an IPA element here. Tart and tangy and sour yet refreshing and with a hoppy undertow. More of a refreshing summer beer I think, however I am happy drinking it late November. A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov14 3.5
